org.jbei.ice.services.rest

Class RestResource

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jbei.ice.services.rest.RestResource
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AccessTokenResource, AnnotationResource, ApiKeyResource, BulkUploadResource, CollectionResource, ConfigResource, CustomFieldResource, FileResource, FolderResource, GroupResource, ManuscriptResource, MessageResource, PartnerResource, PartResource, PermissionResource, RemoteAccessResource, SampleResource, SearchResource, UserResource, WebResource

    public class RestResource
extends Object
    Parent class for all rest resource objects. Handles session validation as well as return responses based on specific values
    Author:
    Hector Plahar

      • getUserId

        protected String getUserId()
        Extract the User ID from header values in the resource request.
        Returns:
        a string User ID
        Throws:
        javax.ws.rs.WebApplicationException - for unauthorized access

      • requireUserId

        protected String requireUserId()
        Attempts to retrieve the identifier for the specific user
        Returns:
        valid user identifier
        Throws:
        javax.ws.rs.WebApplicationException - with status 401 if the user id cannot be retrieved

      • respond

        protected javax.ws.rs.core.Response respond(javax.ws.rs.core.Response.Status status,
                                            Object obj)
        Create a Response object from an entity object.
        Parameters:
        status - HTTP status code
        obj - entity in response
        Returns:
        a Response object for the resource request, uses 500 error response if entity is null

      • respond

        protected javax.ws.rs.core.Response respond(Object object)
        Create a Response object from an entity object.
        Parameters:
        object - entity in response
        Returns:
        a 404 NOT FOUND if object is null, else a 200 OK response with the entity

      • respond

        protected javax.ws.rs.core.Response respond(javax.ws.rs.core.Response.Status status)
        Create an empty Response object.
        Parameters:
        status - HTTP status code to use on the Response
        Returns:
        a Response object for the resource request

      • respond

        protected javax.ws.rs.core.Response respond(boolean success)
        Create an empty Response object.
        Parameters:
        success - success/failure flag
        Returns:
        a 200 OK response if success is true, otherwise a 500 error response
